verses.text: 我們堅強的人，應該擔當不堅強的人的軟弱，不應該求自己的喜悅。
我們各人務要叫鄰舍喜悅，好讓他得到益處、得到造就。

words.note: Formal/emphatic way of saying 'must'

words.definition: so that, in order to let

words.note: Refers to spiritual building up or growth

verses.text: 因為連基督也不求自己的喜悅；反而像經上所記的：「辱罵你的人的辱罵，都落在我的身上。」

words.note: Indicates something that has been recorded or written.

verses.text: 從前經上所寫的，都是為教訓我們而寫的，好使我們藉著忍耐和聖經中的安慰得著盼望。

words.note: Indicates something that has been written.

words.definition: so that, in order to make

words.note: Literally 'Holy Classic'
A more formal or literary equivalent of 得到.

verses.text: 願賜忍耐和安慰的 神，使你們彼此同心，效法基督耶穌，

words.note: Refers to the Christian God; the preceding space is a mark of reverence.

verses.text: 同心一致地榮耀我們主耶穌基督的父 神。

words.definition: united in spirit, of one accord
words.note: Lit. 'same heart, one consistency'.
Often used in religious contexts to describe giving glory to God.
Capitalized when referring to God or Christ.
Refers to God the Father.

verses.text: 神因此，你們應當彼此接納，就像基督接納了你們一樣，使榮耀歸於 神。
verses.heading: Exhortation to Mutual Acceptance

verses.text: 我說，基督為了 神的真理，成了受割禮的人的僕人，為的是要證實對祖先的應許，

words.definition: for the sake of, in order to

words.note: Often refers to divine truth in scripture.
Refers to the religious rite of circumcision.
In biblical context, often refers to a servant of God or others for God's purposes.

words.definition: in order to, for the purpose of

words.note: Often refers to divine promises in scripture.

verses.text: 使外族人因著所蒙的憐憫榮耀 神；如經上所記：「因此我要在列邦中稱讚你，歌頌你的名。」

words.note: Indicates that the following verb is being made into a nominal phrase.
Often refers to God's mercy.

verses.text: 又說：「列邦啊，當與他的子民一同快樂。」

words.note: Often refers to God's chosen people.

verses.text: 又說：「萬國啊，你們當讚美主；願萬民都頌讚他。」

words.note: Indicates obligation or strong suggestion.
Often capitalized in Christian texts, referring to God/Christ.

verses.text: 以賽亞也說：「將來必有耶西的根，就是那興起來治理列邦的；列邦都寄望於他。」

words.note: Refers to a descendant or source, often of a royal line.
Used after a verb to indicate direction or completion.
Forms a nominal phrase from a verb or adjective.
Classical Chinese preposition.

verses.text: 願那賜盼望的 神，因著你們的信，把一切喜樂平安充滿你們，使你們靠著聖靈的大能滿有盼望。

words.note: Refers to the Abrahamic God. The preceding space is a reverence marker.
Introduces the object of a verb before the verb itself.
Refers to the Holy Spirit in Christian theology.

verses.text: 我的弟兄們，我個人深信你們自己也滿有良善，充滿豐富的知識，也能夠彼此勸導。
verses.heading: Paul’s Motivation for Writing the Letter

verses.text: 但有些地方，我寫得稍為大膽一點，是要提醒你們；我因著 神賜給我的恩典，

words.note: Links a verb to its descriptive complement.
Refers to the Abrahamic God. The preceding space is a reverence marker.

verses.text: 為外族人作了基督耶穌的僕役，作了 神福音的祭司，使所獻上的外族人得蒙悅納，靠著聖靈成為聖潔。

words.note: Refers to non-Jewish people.
The blank space is a reverence marker for God.
Lit. 'blessed news'.
Often indicates a polite passive voice, receiving something good.

verses.text: 所以，在 神的事上，我在基督耶穌裡倒有可以引以為榮的。

words.note: Used as a postposition to indicate scope.
Often used as a postposition with 在.

words.definition: to take pride in, to boast

verses.text: 別的我不敢說，我只說基督藉著我所作的事，就是用言語行為，藉著神蹟和奇事的大能，以及聖靈的大能，使外族人順服；這樣，我從耶路撒冷直到以利里古，把基督的福音都傳開了。
我立定主意，不在宣揚過基督的地方傳福音，免得建立在別人的根基上，

words.note: A verb-object compound.
Used as a locative suffix.

verses.text: 反而照經上所記：「那對他一無所聞的，將要看見；那沒有聽過的，將要明白。」

words.note: Often refers to 'in the Bible' or 'as it is written'.
An idiom meaning utterly ignorant of something.

verses.text: 因此，我多次受到攔阻，不能到你們那裡去。
verses.heading: Paul’s Intention of Visiting the Romans

verses.text: 但現在這一帶再沒有可傳的地方，而我多年來又很想去見你們，
所以，無論我甚麼時候到西班牙去，都希望趁我路過時和你們見面，先稍微滿足我的心願，然後由你們給我送行到那裡去。
不過，我現在為了供應聖徒的事要往耶路撒冷去；

words.note: Lit. 'holy disciples'.

verses.text: 因為馬其頓和亞該亞人樂意捐了一些錢，給耶路撒冷聖徒中的窮人。

words.note: Here, refers to people from Macedonia and Achaia.
Lit. 'holy disciples'.

verses.text: 他們是樂意的，而且那也是他們的本分（「本分」原文作「債」），因為外族人既然分享了猶太人屬靈的好處，就應該供應他們肉身的需要。

words.note: Lit. 'original share/duty'

verses.text: 等我辦好這件事，把這筆款項安全地交了給他們，我就要路過你們那裡到西班牙去。
我知道我到你們那裡去的時候，一定會帶著基督豐盛的福分。
弟兄們，我靠著我們的主耶穌基督，憑著聖靈的慈愛，勸你們和我一同竭力為我向 神祈禱，

words.note: Lit. 'Holy Spirit'
The preceding space indicates reverence in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 求 神救我脫離猶太地不信從的人，使我帶到耶路撒冷的捐款，可以得到聖徒的悅納；

words.note: The preceding space indicates reverence in Chinese Bibles.

words.definition: to escape from, be free of

verses.text: 也使我照著 神的旨意，高高興興地到你們那裡去，好和你們一同得到安息。

words.note: The raised space indicates reverence for God in Chinese Bibles.
Often refers to divine will in religious texts.
Reduplicated form 'AABB地' emphasizes the manner of action.
Often refers to spiritual rest or the Sabbath.

verses.text: 願賜平安的 神與你們眾人同在。阿們。

words.note: Used to express a wish or desire, often followed by a clause.
Often used in formal or religious contexts for divine giving.
In biblical context, often refers to spiritual peace.
The raised space indicates reverence for God in Chinese Bibles.
More formal than '和' (hé) when used as a preposition.
Often used in religious contexts to describe God's presence.
A transliteration of the Hebrew word, meaning 'so be it' or 'truly'.
